metadata.title: Example data for the SAFE Project
metadata.description:
Description:

This is an example dataset to demonstrate the formatting of tabular datasets for the SAFE project. <br><br>Please note that you can use carriage returns within a cell!

Funding: These data were collected as part of research funded by:

  • NERC(Standard grantNE/K006339/1 https://gtr.ukri.org/projects?ref=NE%2FK006339%2F1)

This dataset is released under the CC-BY 4.0 licence, requiring that you cite the dataset in any outputs, but has the additional condition that you acknowledge the contribution of these funders in any outputs.

Permits: These data were collected under permit from the following authorities:

  • Sabah Biodiversity Centre (Research licence A-123-456)
  • Sabah Biodiversity Centre (Export licence B-567-890)

XML metadata: GEMINI compliant metadata for this dataset is available here

Files: This dataset consists of 1 files: Test_format_good_NCBI.xlsx

Test_format_good_NCBI.xlsx

This file contains dataset metadata and 3 data tables:

  1. My data table (described in worksheet DF)

    Description: This is a test data worksheet

    Number of fields: 19

    Number of data rows: 1029

    Fields:

    • Location: SAFE 2nd order point number (Field type: location)
    • Date: Collection date (Field type: date)
    • Latitude: GPS Lat for sample point (Field type: latitude)
    • Longitude: GPS Long for sample point (Field type: longitude)
    • QuadratNumber: Four replicates (Field type: replicate)
    • Status: Something (Field type: numeric)
    • Treat: Something else (Field type: categorical)
    • Level: Something else (Field type: categorical)
    • Time: Something else (Field type: categorical)
    • Rain: Something else (Field type: numeric)
    • Group: Something else (Field type: numeric)
    • Obs_Time: A time (Field type: time)
    • Datetime: A date time field (Field type: datetime)
    • Taxon: The taxon studied (Field type: taxa)
    • TagNumber: Pit tags for the ants (Field type: id)
    • Species_count: The species abundance (Field type: abundance)
    • Ant_mass: The average individual mass (Field type: numeric trait)
    • Caste: The caset of the individuals weighed (Field type: ordered categorical trait)
    • Lizard_predation: Consumption of ants by lizards (Field type: numeric interaction)
    • Comments: My comments (Field type: comments)

  2. My incidence matrix (described in worksheet Incidence)

    Description: A test data worksheet too

    Number of fields: 6

    Number of data rows: 102

    Fields:

    • Location: SAFE 2nd order point number (Field type: location)
    • Date: Collection date (Field type: date)
    • Cr_bo: Abundance of species (Field type: abundance)
    • Do_sp: Abundance of species (Field type: abundance)
    • Fo_1: Abundance of species (Field type: abundance)
    • Morph_1: Abundance of species (Field type: abundance)
    • Cr_bo_mass: Average mass of species (Field type: numeric trait)

  3. My sequencing data table (described in worksheet MicrobeDF)

    Description: Another test worksheet

    Number of fields: 5

    Number of data rows: 14

    Fields:

    • Location: SAFE 2nd order point number (Field type: location)
    • Latitude: GPS Lat for sample point (Field type: latitude)
    • Longitude: GPS Long for sample point (Field type: longitude)
    • Species_count: The number of each taxon detected by sequencing (Field type: abundance)
    • Taxon: The taxon studied (Field type: taxa)
    • Comments: My comments (Field type: comments)

Date range: 2012-06-01 to 2012-07-30

Latitudinal extent: 4.5000 to 5.0700

Longitudinal extent: 116.7500 to 117.8200

Taxonomic coverage:
This dataset contains data associated with taxa and these have been validated against appropriate taxonomic authority databases.

GBIF taxa details:

The following taxa were validated against the GBIF backbone dataset.If a dataset uses a synonym, the accepted usage is shown followed by the dataset usage in brackets. Taxa that cannot be validated, including new species and other unknown taxa, morphospecies, functional groups and taxonomic levels not used in the GBIF backbone are shown in square brackets.

NCBI taxa details:

The following taxa were validated against the NCBI taxonomy dataset. If a dataset uses a synonym, the accepted usage is shown followed by the dataset usage in brackets. Taxa that cannot be validated, e.g. new or unknown species are shown in square brackets. Non-backbone taxonomic ranks (e.g. strains or subphyla) can be validated using the NCBI database. However, they will only be shown if the user explicitly provided a non-backbone taxon. When they are shown they will be accompanied by an message stating their rank.
